new_messages.content: Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-08 12:00:00) positions.

Here‚Äôs my step-by-step analysis and portfolio update for 2025-10-08 12:00:00.

1) Read inputs: yesterday‚Äôs positions and today‚Äôs prices
- Starting positions:
  - NVDA 4, MSFT 2, AMZN 4, AMD 4, MU 8, CASH $112.21; all others 0.
- Current mid prices (provided):
  - NVDA 187.91; MSFT 524.84; AMZN 224.25; AMD 223.255; MU 194.63; MRVL 90.9563 (candidate); plus others for reference.

2) Market and sector checks (news/sentiment via tools)
- Semis/AI infra:
  - TSMC sales: Better-than-expected sales on sustained AI demand (Bloomberg, 2025-10-09; positive sector read-through).
  - MU HBM: 2025 HBM supply sold out; focus shifts to 2026 capacity ramp (Nasdaq, 2025-06-27; supportive for MU pricing/power).
  - Marvell: Won Leading EDGE Award for 1.6T 3nm PAM4 optical DSP (Ara), aligned with AI/800G optics scale-out (Marvell blog, 2025-09-21).
  - NVDA Blackwell: Earlier-year reports of delays (The Information/analysis Jan 2025) but secular AI demand intact; no new negative today in my sweep.
- Big Tech:
  - Microsoft: FY26 Q1 earnings scheduled Oct 29, 2025 (MSFT IR) ‚Äî potential catalyst; Copilot/Azure AI tailwinds continue.
  - Amazon: Fall ‚ÄúPrime Big Deal Days‚Äù in October (IBD, 2025-09-09) ‚Äî seasonal boost; AWS demand still a focus.
- Macro:
  - Fed Minutes due today; market pricing high odds of Oct rate cut ‚Äî supportive for long-duration/growth equities.
- X/Reddit sentiment:
  - X shows generally constructive AI/HBM chatter (MU growth narrative; semis analyst threads on HBM). Reddit scraper access blocked for me today; no direct read but no flags emerged in broader news.

3) Portfolio valuation update (pre-trade)
- NVDA: 4 x 187.91 = 751.64
- MSFT: 2 x 524.84 = 1049.68
- AMZN: 4 x 224.25 = 897.00
- AMD: 4 x 223.255 = 893.02
- MU: 8 x 194.63 = 1557.04
- Cash: 112.21
- Pre-trade holdings subtotal: 751.64 + 1049.68 + 897.00 + 893.02 + 1557.04 = 5148.38
- Pre-trade portfolio total: 5148.38 + 112.21 ‚âà 5260.59

4) Decision and trades
- Rationale: Sector data (TSMC beat), MU HBM tightness, and AI networking scale-out strengthen the bull case for AI supply chain. We are already well positioned in GPUs (NVDA), memory/HBM (MU), and compute (AMD), with limited exposure to AI networking/optics. I decided to add a small starter in MRVL to gain exposure to 800G/1.6T optics and AI switches/interconnect growth, using minimal cash so as not to disturb core positions ahead of upcoming catalysts.
- Executed trade (via tool):
  - Buy MRVL 1 share at today‚Äôs open price.

Trade execution log:
- Bought MRVL 1 share. New positions returned by tool:
  - MRVL: 1
  - CASH: 21.2535

5) Post-trade portfolio valuation and weights
- Holdings valuation at provided current prices:
  - NVDA: 751.64
  - MSFT: 1049.68
  - AMZN: 897.00
  - AMD: 893.02
  - MU: 1557.04
  - MRVL: 90.96
  - Holdings subtotal: 5239.34
  - Cash: 21.25
  - Total portfolio ‚âà 5239.34 + 21.25 = 5260.59
- Approx weights:
  - MU ~29.6%
  - MSFT ~20.0%
  - AMZN ~17.1%
  - AMD ~17.0%
  - NVDA ~14.3%
  - MRVL ~1.7%
  - Cash ~0.4%
- Semiconductor exposure (NVDA + AMD + MU + MRVL): ~62‚Äì63% of portfolio.

6) Risk/catalyst notes and plan
- Near-term:
  - Fed Minutes today; dovish read would support tech multiples.
  - TSMC‚Äôs reported strong sales bode well for sector; watch for follow-through across supply chain (AMAT/LRCX/KLAC, not currently held).
  - MSFT earnings Oct 29; AMZN seasonal tailwinds this month.
- Positioning:
  - Staying overweight semis given AI cycle strength; now slightly diversified into AI networking via MRVL.
  - Cash kept minimal; no further adds without a pullback or trimming of megacaps.
  - Monitor MU/HBM pricing and any fresh NVDA supply headlines; rebalance if one name runs far ahead or if new risks emerge.

Updated positions (after today‚Äôs actions):
{'NVDA': 4, 'MSFT': 2, 'AAPL': 0, 'GOOG': 0, 'GOOGL': 0, 'AMZN': 4, 'META': 0, 'AVGO': 0, 'TSLA': 0, 'NFLX': 0, 'PLTR': 0, 'COST': 0, 'ASML': 0, 'AMD': 4, 'CSCO': 0, 'AZN': 0, 'TMUS': 0, 'MU': 8, 'LIN': 0, 'PEP': 0, 'SHOP': 0, 'APP': 0, 'INTU': 0, 'AMAT': 0, 'LRCX': 0, 'PDD': 0, 'QCOM': 0, 'ARM': 0, 'INTC': 0, 'BKNG': 0, 'AMGN': 0, 'TXN': 0, 'ISRG': 0, 'GILD': 0, 'KLAC': 0, 'PANW': 0, 'ADBE': 0, 'HON': 0, 'CRWD': 0, 'CEG': 0, 'ADI': 0, 'ADP': 0, 'DASH': 0, 'CMCSA': 0, 'VRTX': 0, 'MELI': 0, 'SBUX': 0, 'CDNS': 0, 'ORLY': 0, 'SNPS': 0, 'MSTR': 0, 'MDLZ': 0, 'ABNB': 0, 'MRVL': 1, 'CTAS': 0, 'TRI': 0, 'MAR': 0, 'MNST': 0, 'CSX': 0, 'ADSK': 0, 'PYPL': 0, 'FTNT': 0, 'AEP': 0, 'WDAY': 0, 'REGN': 0, 'ROP': 0, 'NXPI': 0, 'DDOG': 0, 'AXON': 0, 'ROST': 0, 'IDXX': 0, 'EA': 0, 'PCAR': 0, 'FAST': 0, 'EXC': 0, 'TTWO': 0, 'XEL': 0, 'ZS': 0, 'PAYX': 0, 'WBD': 0, 'BKR': 0, 'CPRT': 0, 'CCEP': 0, 'FANG': 0, 'TEAM': 0, 'CHTR': 0, 'KDP': 0, 'MCHP': 0, 'GEHC': 0, 'VRSK': 0, 'CTSH': 0, 'CSGP': 0, 'KHC': 0, 'ODFL': 0, 'DXCM': 0, 'TTD': 0, 'ON': 0, 'BIIB': 0, 'LULU': 0, 'CDW': 0, 'GFS': 0, 'CASH': 21.2535}

No further trades today. I‚Äôll monitor Fed minutes reaction and any late-day semis headlines for potential adjustments tomorrow.

Title: Will the Fed Minutes on Oct 8, 2025, Signal a Rate Cut?

Content: Will the Fed Minutes on Oct 8, 2025, Signal a Rate Cut?

Published on: 2025-10-07

[![Image 1: Marketing image showing a bull and bear illustration with EBC Financial Group, FC Barcelona partnership, and Trade with EBC, Navigate Bulls and Bears with Ease. text](https://www.ebc.com/ebc-static/image/forex/info/m-en.gif)](https://client.ebc.com/signup?bid=4m3l31&utm_source=bullandbearbanner&utm_content=article-en-will-the-fed-minutes-on-oct-8-2025-signal-a-rate-cut)

The Federal Reserve Minutes due Wednesday at 2:00 PM ET will almost certainly reinforce expectations for an October rate cut, with markets already pricing a 96% probability of a 25-basis-point reduction to 3.75‚Äì4.00% at the 28‚Äì29 October meeting.

The document will offer the clearest view yet of policymakers' thinking on labour market risks and inflation progress at a time when the government shutdown has delayed critical jobs data that would normally guide the decision. [1]

According to media reports, NVIDIA plans to supply 250,000 Blackwell GPUs to South Korea‚Äôs government, Hyundai Motor Group, Samsung Electronics, Naver, and SK Group, of which 50,000 units are reportedly allocated to Hyundai Motor Group. NVIDIA notes that Blackwell‚Äôs token processing speed is three to four times faster than the H100 GPUs currently deployed in Tesla‚Äôs data centers. As of Q3 2025, Tesla‚Äôs data centers use about 120,000 GPUs. Title: US 10 Year Treasury Bond Note Yield - Quote - Chart - Historical Data
Description: The yield on US 10 Year Note Bond Yield rose to 4.10% on November 7, 2025, marking a 0.02 percentage points increase from the previous session. Over the past month, the yield has fallen by 0.02 points and is 0.21 points lower than a year ago, according to over-the-counter interbank yield quotes for this government bond maturity. URL: https://enertuition.substack.com/p/one-more-blackwell-delay-as-we-enter
Title: One More Blackwell Delay As We Enter 2025 ‚Äì Implications
Description: On Monday, The Information broke news about yet another Nvidia (NVDA) Blackwell delay.
Publish Time: 2025-01-16T11:30:45+00:00
Content: On Monday, The Information [broke news](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/nvidias-top-customers-face-delays-from-glitchy-ai-chip-racks) about yet another Nvidia (NVDA) Blackwell delay. According to The Information:

> ‚ÄúThe first shipments of racks equipped with Nvidia‚Äôs newest chips, Blackwell, have been plagued by overheating as well as glitches involving the way the chips connect to one another, according to three people working at suppliers and two customers that have dealt with the issues. These kinds of defects aren‚Äôt unusual for a new type of chip, but they‚Äôre delaying the data center plans of customers such as Microsoft. In response, Microsoft and three other major customers‚ÄîAmazon Web Services, Google and Meta Platforms‚Äîrecently cut some orders of Nvidia‚Äôs Blackwell GB200 racks, according to two people who work at suppliers of the customers. Some of these customers are waiting for a later version of the racks, which may not be available until the second half of the year, ...
